title: How to Make Carrot Cake Doughnuts

steps.headline: Mix the wet ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, beat the sugar and butter with a stand or hand mixer.

steps.headline: Incorporate the yogurt, egg, and vanilla into the bowl.
Add the pineapple and carrots last.
Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Use a medium bowl to combine the cinnamon, flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg with a metal wire whisk.

steps.headline: Incorporate the two bowls.
steps.description: Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time between stirring.

steps.headline: Fill a doughnut pan.
steps.description: Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about ½ full.

steps.headline: Allow the doughnuts to cool.
steps.description: Leave them in the pan for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Combine the frosting ingredients together (except the walnuts).
steps.description: In a small bowl, use a metal wire whisk to whip everything thoroughly until you achieve a smooth mixture.

steps.headline: Dip the doughnuts into the frosting.
Garnish the doughnuts.
steps.description: Before the frosting sets, sprinkle some chopped walnuts around.

text: Making the Batter Mix the wet ingredients. In a large bowl, beat the sugar and butter with a stand or hand mixer. Incorporate the yogurt, egg, and vanilla into the bowl.  Add the pineapple and carrots last. Mix everything thoroughly. Mix the dry ingredients. Use a medium bowl to combine the cinnamon, flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg with a metal wire whisk. Incorporate the two bowls. Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time between stirring. Baking the Doughnuts Fill a doughnut pan. Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about ½ full. Bake the doughnuts for 10 minutes.  Allow the doughnuts to cool. Leave them in the pan for a few minutes. Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack. Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes. Making and Applying the Frosting Combine the frosting ingredients together (except the walnuts). In a small bowl, use a metal wire whisk to whip everything thoroughly until you achieve a smooth mixture. Dip the doughnuts into the frosting.  Garnish the doughnuts. Before the frosting sets, sprinkle some chopped walnuts around.
sentences: Making the Batter Mix the wet ingredients.
In a large bowl, beat the sugar and butter with a stand or hand mixer.
Incorporate the yogurt, egg, and vanilla into the bowl.
Add the pineapple and carrots last.
Mix everything thoroughly.
Mix the dry ingredients.
Use a medium bowl to combine the cinnamon, flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg with a metal wire whisk.
Incorporate the two bowls.
Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl.
For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time between stirring.
Baking the Doughnuts Fill a doughnut pan.
Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about ½ full.
Bake the doughnuts for 10 minutes.
Allow the doughnuts to cool.
Leave them in the pan for a few minutes.
Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack.
Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.
Making and Applying the Frosting Combine the frosting ingredients together (except the walnuts).
In a small bowl, use a metal wire whisk to whip everything thoroughly until you achieve a smooth mixture.
Dip the doughnuts into the frosting.
Garnish the doughnuts.
Before the frosting sets, sprinkle some chopped walnuts around.
